result.execSummary:
The defendant Elias Lamont Carroll Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with: R.B., V.B. or their residence.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/COURT COSTS,FEES, SURCHARGE, ETC:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or the means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing OCTOBER 23, 2014 received and filed.
Order Amending Judgement of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections
Witness fee request prepared for Virginia B. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

  PSI report is not available, parties wish to proceed without it.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Virginia B.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 274 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program, but IS eligible for the Earned Release program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: RB, VB or their residence.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,040.40 payable to RB or VB; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Virginia B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26199813 in court 1x on 5/21/14.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Richard B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26199812 in court 1x on 5/21/14.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Olgalis A. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26199811 in court 1x on 5/21/14.

Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to negotiations, the repeater enhanced on Count 1 is dismissed.  Counts 2-5 are dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
 Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 7/23/14 for Olgalis A., Virginia B., Richard B. for 1 appearance each on 5/21/14.

Attorney Lori A Kuehn in court, defendant Elias Lamont Carroll not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-21-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lori H Kuehn in court, defendant Elias Lamont Carroll not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kuehn has accepted appointment as counsel for the defense.
Status Conference is scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.
Status Conference scheduled for 07-07-2014 at 08:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SPEEDY JURY TRIAL, scheduled to start today, is removed from Court's Calendar at Defendant's request due to Defendant's request for new counsel.  Victim Virginia B addresses Court as to witness availability for a new trial date.  State Prosecutor raises the possibility of motioning the Court for Deposing of Witnesses for reasons stated on the record.  Court will take that motion under advisement if it is presented to the Court at a later time.

Defense Counsel files motion to withdraw.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 22.  Status Of Counsel Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.

SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND is WITHDRAWN, with the understanding that a SPEEDY Trial Demand may be presented by newly appointed counsel for the defense. 


  Status conference scheduled for 06-03-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
For reasons stated on the record, Defense Motion for Withdrawal of Counsel is withdrawn.  SPEEDY Jury Trial, already calendared for 05-21-2014 at 09:00am in Branch 22, remains as calendared.
Defendant's Requested, FILED.
FILED.

Call received from Defense Counsel, Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobbs, to schedule Motion Hearing for Motion to Withdraw.  Due to conflict in his calendar and Court's Calendar, Motion Hearing will be heard on 05-05-2014 at 08:30am, which is the time set for Final Pretrial in this matter.  Attorney Opland-Dobbs informed that SPEEDY JURY TRIAL DEMAND scheduled 02-21-2014 will be affected by this motion to withdraw.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Elias Lamont Carroll not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski, and Thomas Potter, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Potter brings notification to this Court of the relationship of the victims in this matter to a Milwaukee County employee.  For reasons stated on the record, Court finds no conflict at this time.  
SPEEDY JURY TRIAL DEMAND FILED ORALLY WITH THE COURT.
Final Pretrial scheduled for 05-05-2014 and Speedy  Jury trial scheduled for 05-21-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Lucas Binter-West Allis Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with P.R., R.B., V.B., AND JOSE R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).
  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Elias Lamont Carroll in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty FOR MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 3, 4, AND 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
